div.p: REPLEVIN in law, a remedy granted on a diſtreſs, by which the fi ſt poffeffor has his goods reſtored to him again, on his giving ſecurity to the ſheriff that he will purſue his action againſt the party diſtraining, and return the goods or cattle if the taking them ſliall be adjudged lawful.
In a replevin the perſon diſtrained becomes plaintiff ; and the perſon diſtraining is called the defendant or avowant, and his juſtification an avowry.

At the common law replevins are by writ, either out of the king’s-bench or common-pleas ; but by ſtatute, they are by plaint in the ſheriff’s cyurt, and court-baron, for a perfon’g more ſpeedily obtaining the goods diſtrained.

If a plaint in replevin bc removed 'into' the court of king’s-bench, &c. and the plaintiff makes default and becomes non-ſuit, or judgment is given againſt him, the defendant hr replevin ſhall have the writ of retorno habendo of the goods taken in diſtreſs. See the next article.
